description.long: Hydration isn't just for hot days; it's for your brain, your energy, and your general existence. Fill up a glass, keep it nearby, and take a sip every so often. Before you know it, you'll hit 8 without even thinking about it.
Your body called—it's begging for some love. Take 15 minutes to stretch out those tight spots. Neck, shoulders, legs—whatever feels like it's been ignored for too long. Don't overthink it; just move.

Poetry doesn't have to rhyme or even make sense—just grab a pen (or your notes app) and write a few lines about something on your mind. It could be as random as your breakfast or as deep as the meaning of life. Who’s judging? Nobody.

Unplugging sounds harder than it is. Put your phone down, shove it in a drawer if you have to, and do something that doesn’t involve a screen. Read a book, stare at the sky, doodle in a notebook—literally anything. Trust me, two hours will fly
